subject: Mental Health
title: Grief and the Immune System
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Grief and the Immune System.

hook.text: Widows and widowers get sicker more often in the year following a spouse's death.

buildup.text: Grief activates the HPA axis, flooding the body with cortisol and inflammatory markers.

twist.text: This immune suppression explains why bereaved people are more vulnerable to infections and cancer.

climax.text: Social support and adequate sleep partially buffer the immune effects of grief.

punchline.text: A broken heart really does weaken the body.
